posts.post_content:
I absolutely love the implications this card has from a flavor perspective. "So apparently God [judged the world](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=129808) and decided it was in need of purification. His only problem? ***He didn't ask me first!*** Bwahahahaha!"  
  
  
@supershawn  
*"\*\*\* classic, everytime someone plays cancel I laugh at them, I tell them cancel only exists so that you can have moar counterspells in your deck, your not supposed to put them in unless you already have 4 of these."*  
  
[Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel) exists because a 2 CMC universal hard counter was deemed to be too good and is meant played in formats where [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) isn't legal. If you're playing [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel) as counterspells 5-8, you need to brush up on your counters. Not only is there [Force of Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force of Will), but there's also [Dissipate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dissipate), which is only not strictly better if your strategy revolves around your opponent havi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Paleopaladin (5/3/2011 12:51:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Counterspell, also known as **Deploy Derp.**  
  
I include one copy in any blue deck I run in Legacy, 'cause nobody expects it and it's hilarious. Sometimes it's a dead spell in my hand, sure, but I can't tell you how many times it blew people's minds -- they're so used to seeing janky alternative casting cost counterspells, a good ol' boy DERP takes them by complete surprise.  
  
"I crack my [Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal)s, and cast [Ad Nauseam](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ad Nauseam)..." **DERP!**  
  
"I Delve these cards from my graveyard to cast [Tombstalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tombstalker)..." **DERP!**  
  
"I activate [Shelldock Isle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shelldock Isle) to cast Emrakul..." **DERP!** "...uh, Emrakul's uncounterable." **HERP DERP!**  
  
(If you're gonna lose to 15/15 annihilation, you might as well do so in *style*. And yes, saying **DERP!** is mandatory.)
posts.html:
Counterspell, also known as Deploy Derp.

I include one copy in any blue deck I run in Legacy, 'cause nobody expects it and it's hilarious. Sometimes it's a dead spell in my hand, sure, but I can't tell you how many times it blew people's minds -- they're so used to seeing janky alternative casting cost counterspells, a good ol' boy DERP takes them by complete surprise.

"I crack my Lotus Petals, and cast Ad Nauseam..." DERP!

"I Delve these cards from my graveyard to cast Tombstalker..." DERP!

"I activate Shelldock Isle to cast Emrakul..." DERP! "...uh, Emrakul's uncounterable." HERP DERP!

(If you're gonna lose to 15/15 annihilation, you might as well do so in style. And yes, saying DERP! is mandatory.)

Posted By: boneclub (11/21/2011 10:18:31 PM)

posts.post_content:
C'mon Wizards- it's time to give up and just reprint this.  
It's not like it's freaking [Mana Drain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Drain).  
  
You already caved with [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt);  
Is Counterspell really *that* much worse from a power perspective?  
  
You've also had no issue with creating new creatures which completely outclass creatures that were already considered very powerful (see: [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel)).  
  
Don't get me wrong- bringing back [Dissipate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dissipate) is a step in the right direction  
re: undoing the mistake that was [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel),  
but it will never be truly forgiven until you bring this back.
posts.html:
C'mon Wizards- it's time to give up and just reprint this.
It's not like it's freaking Mana Drain.

You already caved with Lightning Bolt;
Is Counterspell really that much worse from a power perspective?

You've also had no issue with creating new creatures which completely outclass creatures that were already considered very powerful (see: Baneslayer Angel).

Don't get me wrong- bringing back Dissipate is a step in the right direction
re: undoing the mistake that was Cancel,
but it will never be truly forgiven until you bring this back.
